Name: Swizzles Cocktail
Ingredients: 20 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: POUR all ingredients into chilled glass and two-thirds fill with crushed ice. SWIZZLE with a swizzle stick (or churn with a barspoon). Add more crushed ice to fill and SWIZZLE some more. Serve with straws.
Review: Somewhat reminiscent of a frozen gimlet – the combination of gin and lime shines in this freshening swizzle.
History: Adapted from a recipe in Harry Craddock 's 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book .
Nutrition: One serving of Swizzles Cocktail contains 202 calories
Garnish: Crown with a few dashes of aromatic bitters over ice peak, plus juniper or blueberries
